revised_title: Understanding Bacterial Interference with Host Defences: A Review
tldr: This article discusses the challenges in identifying the determinants of bacterial interference with non-specific host defenses during the early stages of infection. It highlights the difficulties in proving causation and the importance of studying organisms grown in vivo. The author provides a brief survey of the activities of various pathogenic bacteria, focusing on recent work on the resistance of gonococci to killing by human serum and phagocytes.
